line_1: Pleasure herself perhaps suggests a plea,
line_2: If int'rest move thee, to persuade ev'n thee:

line_1: When neebors anger at a plea,
line_2: An' just as wud as wud can be,

line_1: When neebors anger at a plea,
line_2: How easy can the barley-brie

line_1: When neebors anger at a plea,
line_2: It's aye the cheapest Lawyer's fee

line_1: 'Twad been nae plea;
line_2: That's owre the Sea!

line_1: The Proteus H—LL put in his modest plea —
line_2: Let favour speak for others, worth for me.

line_1: I first discover'd it, nor shall that plea
line_2: To Her be granted, and denied to Me.

line_1: When sovereign might acknowledg'd reason's plea,
line_2: That heaven created man for liberty.

line_1: When, to confirm his lofty plea,
line_2: The grave Venetian weds the sea:

line_1: So none for Pardon has a fairer Plea.
line_2: For as none guilty has less Guilt than he,

line_1: But still in virtue of a Savior's plea,
line_2: Not blind by choice, but destin'd not to see.

line_1: I cast them at thy feet — my only plea
line_2: Is what it was, dependence upon thee;

line_1: To th' upright sentence, or rhetorick plea;
line_2: At bench, or bar, I add a dignity

line_1: Talk not of Custom — 'tis the Coward's plea,
line_2: Current with Fools, but passes not with me;

line_1: Thou would'st not, deaf to Nature's tend'rest plea,
line_2: Turn him adrift upon a rolling sea,

line_1: Let Malice strip them of each other plea,
line_2: They still are men, and men shou'd still be free.

line_1: Where ignorance will be found the surest plea,
line_2: How many learn'd and wise shall envy thee!

line_1: Prosper (I press thee with a pow'rful plea)
line_2: A task I venture on, impell'd by thee:

line_1: Were hush'd in favour of thy gen'rous plea,
line_2: The poor thy clients, and heaven's smile thy fee.

line_1: This only spares no lust, admits no plea,
line_2: But makes him, if at all, completely free,
